website_summaries.verdict: A good buy if you're looking for a large-capacity scoop, but there are a few quality concerns with some of its components.
pros: The rake's teeth are spaced precisely for reliable pick up
Deep design allows for the attachment of bags for easy clean-up
cons: Though the handles potentially adjust to 3 ft., they don't lock into place effectively and slip up and down
Some owners find the scoop's swivel action makes it awkward to empty

customer_reviews.title: Great for Tall Guys but Poor Construction
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my son-in-law. He is 6 foot 2 and this was ideal for him as he could use it without having to bend down. Sadly it lasted only 3 weeks - about 10 uses- before the handle snapped in two. It sheared off at the juncture where the two sections of the handle come together. i ordered it December 7th, gave it to him on January 2nd. By the time he notified me, I just missed the return window, I contacted Amazon Customer service and they agreed to refund my money.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H.

customer_reviews.title: Good product but it needed a few tweaks...
customer_reviews.text: Good product. A couple small tweaks needed to make it a very good product. I glued the handles together and had to trim the top of the bucket so the handle would clear. It would always catch when setting it on the ground. Not any more...
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this product because I liked the idea of being able to do one sweep ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product because I liked the idea of being able to do one sweep of the back yard without having to bend over and without having to empty the container after just a poop or two. I loved it until the stick/scraper snapped in two. Not much use to me now because I’m right back to having to bend over to scoop. I’ve only had this item since January 3rd, I’d hope that it would have lasted me a lot longer than 2 months. Very disappointed with the durability and now looking for a replacement, yet again.
customer_reviews.author: BizzyBea

customer_reviews.title: Buy This!!!
customer_reviews.text: Buy this!!!! You will not be disappointed. Received this yesterday and tackled a back yard full of poo. I have a real mental problem with anything that is disgusting (changing diapers, cleaning vomit etc. Yeah it's bad!! ) and that is why I have let the yard get so bad. Cleaning up was a breeze. No contact with the poo. Just attach a grocery bag and go. To fix the problem with the poles coming loose that other reviewers have noted, I immediately applied super glue to the connections before use. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Deb OKC

customer_reviews.title: really annoying! Also
customer_reviews.text: It’s alright. The rake comes in 3 separate parts to connect as 1 and it constantly gets loose and I have to twist it back tight... really annoying! Also, the rake just goes through the poop rather than raking it up.. only thing I like is that you can put a bag in there and scoop it in there but it doesn’t even do the “scoop” part. it’s pretty pointless. Going back to my regular scooper. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK for the money, but...
customer_reviews.text: Both the rake and container have long poles with 3 pieces that screw together. They continue to come loose (no matter how tight I make it) all the time which is annoying, especially while doing what is an unpleasant chore anyway. Another issue is the rake is flimsy and if the "do-do" is soft it's difficult to clean up the tines on the rake. All in all this product is okay for what you pay for it, but just be ware of issues mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: StoneCrab

customer_reviews.title: Bin kept detaching from handle.  Not happy.
customer_reviews.text: I just go this and was eager to try it out. At first I thought it was great (we tend to pick up dog poop every few days rather than every day so it adds up). But, the swivel bin kept detaching from the handle. It probably did it 3-4 times in one poop pick up session. ugh... so disgusting.. i had to reattach it but the bin already has poop in it. The rake was fine but without a properly functioning bin, I'm not happy with my purchase at all because I'll have to find another bin for it. Not sure if my bin was defective or if all of them are like that...
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Wasted money
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. I loved it the first day when I tried it out, but that’s about it. The handles are in short pieces that screw together, which would be fine if they stayed together. Unfortunately the handles will loosen/unscrew as you try to use this. Not my favorite thing when I’m trying to scoop stinky poop and it keeps falling off the scoop because the handle is twisting. Then, of course, the handle of the scooper piece snapped in half after using it for only a month. Nice product in concept, just really terrible quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mbaj

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for spring cleaning the yard
customer_reviews.text: After using a garden shovel and plastic bags to pick up dog poop for two years, this product has been great to use! Poles are made of metal but the parts where they screw together are plastic. It seems study enough. We put a regular grocery plastic bag in it and it held enough to pretty much fill the bag. My 9 year old daughter has actually volunteered to clean up the yard since we have gotten this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke first day!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the concept of this scooper and I was excited to use it. I think with a few changes it could be great. First, each pole is made of 3 separate poles that screw into each other. This gives too much give, especially for the rake. When going through tough grass the rake pole flexes instead of pushing through. The rake is also made of weak plastic that also gives. The rake portion broke off on the products first task! What a bummer! Until they fix these flaws, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent concept. Handles need improvement.
customer_reviews.text: The handles for these two items leave much to be desired. They are in three pieces that screw together, and as they are used, the handles loosen. That means that the entire time you are using these, you are stopping to tighten the handles. I tried to glue these handles, but they did not glue well. These handles need to be ONE PIECE handles.The box that these arrived in could have easily accommodated the full length handles. The canister part of the scoop works well, and a plastic bag is easily attaches to it for pickup. This product would be excellent if the handles were improved upon and made into one piece handles.
customer_reviews.author: J. Messner

customer_reviews.title: Does the job okay
customer_reviews.text: Which is cleaning up poop in my yard so the kids can play. It's a crappy job this thing has. That being said, I REALLY want this to be sturdier. It hasn't broken yet, but every time I use it, it feels like next time will be the time. You get what you pay for and maybe this thing will come through and surprise me, who knows. It just feels so flimsy. And I have a tiny little terrier with tiny little terrier poops. You'd probably have to make multiple trips is you had a Mastiff or Great Dane because I doubt it could support a monster dog's monster doody.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.andMrs.MorenoTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Good, but had to duct tape all the pieces together.
customer_reviews.text: Overall good, but I needed to duct tape all of the pieces together to prevent them from twisting apart during use. The attachments should not be this easy to twist apart when the device involves some tension/twisting during use. I understand making it piece together for shipping reasons, but it needs to be improved. Haven’t had any issues since duct taping, but prior I was constantly retightening pieces as I used the device.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Clean, neat and easy to use tool for cleaning up after your dog
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how helpful this was to clean up after my two dogs. I don't have to bend over and endure the smell as much now. It was easy to assemble and a shot of Loctite on each section as I screwed it together keeps it from coming apart while using it. I use regular grocery bags in it so it's inexpensive and it doesn't get dirty. If it does get soiled it's any easy fix with a spray of the hose. I've had it several months now and feel it was well worth the purchase price. I highly recommend it, especially if you have multiple large dogs.
customer_reviews.author: HoustonBirder

customer_reviews.title: Pooptastic!
customer_reviews.text: Never in a million years would I have thought I’d leave a review for a pooper scooper. And yet here I am. Pros: 1) I picked up 2 weeks worth of lab turds in under 30 minutes. Half the time as my usual by-hand method! 2) You can recycle grocery store bags - no need to buy them! 3) The added distance kept this a stink-free task too. No gagging. Con: The poles do have a tendency to loosen up. He-Man twisting them will only break them. I need to find some white plumbers tape as another reviewer suggested. I’m pretty sure that’ll do the trick. Summary: Super happy I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: ChristinaW

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Poopin' Puppies
customer_reviews.text: Get two dogs, they said. It'll be just as easy as one, they said. No one mentioned the amount of poop two Golden Retriever puppies could produce...although it wouldn't have changed my mind about getting them. A friend of mind suggested I look for a product like this and of course I found it on Amazon. It's plastic but seems sturdy. It's got a nice long handle on both the bucket and the rake. It's easy to attach the bags - regular plastic bags work great. The size is perfect for now but once the boys are full grown I may need to get the one made for horses. Happy scooping!
customer_reviews.author: Deb P

customer_reviews.title: works decent, after adding tape
customer_reviews.text: good product, as long as you use tape or something to keep it from unscrewing itself as you use it. It is plastic, so I have been extra careful with it, and just use it when the poo is on the harder side. You can use it as a rake to rake it into the bin, but i also sometimes use it like a shovel, and scoop it up from underneath. it seems to not stress the rake as much that way, at least in my case. You can use plastic grocery bags to line the bin as well. It definitely helps me as i have two medium sized dogs, and the poo never stops!
customer_reviews.author: Don N.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good little scooper. I thought I wouldn’t like the fact the the rake tines were plastic instead of metal but they actually work even better. The dont “throw” the poops. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because it comes in pieces that you have to screw into each other. And the will not righted. I am contastly retightening while I’m scooping. And when I try to tighten tighten it Feels like I might break it. Other than that I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Mommynator

customer_reviews.title: Quality, quality, quality ! Excellent Product and price.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best quality pooper scoopers I’ve ever seen. And as for user friendliness.. it’s a 10. You can immediately tell this is a very nice product. Especially for the price, it’s an outstanding value. It’s super easy to put together, even without using the instructions. Everything locks into place by hand, no tools needed. The quality and weight of the materials it’s made of are excellent. I completely expect this to last me a long time and not have to replace it. But if I had to, I would definitely buy the same product again.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Corrals

customer_reviews.title: Not too sturdy especially in winter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this twice because I like the design (Pan and rake) but both times the plastic handle or bin have broken. Once was in the winter when it was cold, so that may have been a factor. The only thing I don't like about the design is that once the bin is full you have to hold onto it to empty it. I wish it had a string or something to let you release it without holding the poopy bin. I also wish it was made of something stronger that the plastic. The rods is screwed together and it has to be tightened over and over again during use as the two parts unscrew as you use them.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Broke the 2nd time it was used. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Prior to my purchase I saw that some buyers reported that the plastic was very cheap and breaks easily. I ignored this and assumed it would be OK because it's the best selling item in it's category on Amazon. Well, I was wrong. This thing broke literally the 2nd time I used it. Now that I've seen the item in person I completely understand why it breaks so easily. Basically, the plastic shafts come in about 3 pieces for the rake as well as the bin, and the plastic is absolute junk. Bottom line... don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: works well have to keep tightening
customer_reviews.text: I prefer these over the clamps because they always grab a chuck of grass with it. So I like this type of scoop and bucket. Plus you can rake it right into a bag and move on. However, for this specific one, the parts keep getting loose, so you have to tighten back up way too often. I had a different one in the past, but it got lost and I couldn't find the exact brand I bought, so I gave this one a try. Not as good as my other one, but I still prefer over the clamp ones personally.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Hahn

customer_reviews.title: great at first,  but not for long
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved this and it worked great to scoop the poop. but it doesn't seem to matter how tight I screw the pieces together, they always come undone as I am scooping the yard which gets really annoying. We have been using this for about 3 months and now the handle for the trash part won't stay connected. The idea is great. I love that it has hooks to attach a bag to, it is just not something that will last long term.
customer_reviews.author: Trash Panda

customer_reviews.title: Nice concept, cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: The ease of this product is amazing although the handle is slightly shorter than I would like. I’m 5’8” and I feel like I need to hunch over while trying to take the dogs recycled dinner into the bin. I’ve had it for maybe 4 months now and its worked great. IF you are rough or ungentle in any way with your equipment, you will NOT want this. My 15 year old son used it once and broke the handle for the rake.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy354

customer_reviews.title: Not just for turds!!
customer_reviews.text: Best thing ever. I cant speak to its ability to pick up dog turds, but it works wonders cleaning up my kids room. He has a million little toys and I pick them up EVERY DAY! I used to crawl around on my hands and knees picking up every little farm animal you can think of, but not any more. This little turd slinger works wonders for toy clean up. The pieces do tend to unscrew like other reviews said, but nothing a little super glue couldn't fix. Not like you are ever going to take it apart again.
customer_reviews.author: BLT

customer_reviews.title: Shizzle Gitter `
customer_reviews.text: Yesterday my wife and I ran barefoot through our yard, holding hands and skipping, and thanks to this Shizzle Gitter our feet were clean. My wife did slip and fall down hill and got her clothes dirty, but that's another product needing reviewed. But there were no oder leaving stains of excrement on her, thanks to this great Shizzle Glitter. I am very please with the sleek design, the aerodynamic design, and the ease of use. Now when My dogs go out side, I actually look forward to their bowel movement.
customer_reviews.author: OhioSportsDad

customer_reviews.title: Best for our Needs
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to keep something around so we could pick up the poo each time they go. This is perfect and what makes it good for us is the storage bucket that takes plastic shopping bags perfectly! It's there and ready when we need it in the back yard. The rake is sturdy and has not come loose at all like others are saying - maybe they improved it? Great for the price and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Denver, CO

customer_reviews.title: Wife stopped using it for back yard clean up
customer_reviews.text: I guess it isn't really a fault of the product but if the poo is not dried/hardened then this doesn't work well at all. I cover the rake with a grocery bag and bought the stronger bags for the bucket portion. It works good enough but the wife quit using it and went back to bending over with the doggy bag to pick up in the back yard. So didn't pass the wife acceptance test. I still use it sometimes because I have bags to get through.
customer_reviews.author: Alex P.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with your left over plastic grocery bags.
customer_reviews.text: I read that the screw together handles can loosen over time so I used glue when I first put it together. A grocery bag fits inside the scoop and I have, so far, been able to clean the rake on the grass. When you take out the bag you can tie it up and throw it out and the scoop is clean. I hang the scoop and put the rake inside the scoop to store them. I consider this to be easy and convenient so far. I clean up after three medium size dogs, so I use it about every four or five days.
customer_reviews.author: Gale

customer_reviews.title: It does what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: It's a good height for me, I don't have to bend over to use this. I had to heat up one of the corners of the scoop and bend the plastic so it would fit through the handle. I'd recommend a dab of silicone on each of the threads in the handles, just to keep them from backing apart. It will hold an entire grocery bag of waste, so if you have a lot to pick up, this should do the job
customer_reviews.author: Chris Petry

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality and worse customer service from Manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend purchasing this product. The quality / durability of the handle on the rake and the bucket are both very poor. The rake broke the first time I used it and the handle on the scoop / bucket cracked (so it's now wrapped in duct tape). The connectors are made of plastic, and the plastic just snapped without much force applied at all. I called the manufacturer and they refused to honor the warranty and told me to return it to Amazon. As I had already used it, I don't really want to wrap up the used poop-scoop-bucket and return it. Lesson learned - avoid this brand and their poor quality and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Frugal Mama

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pooper scooper with a long handle for after surgery. This one is great! After fitting a plastic grocery bag inside I use a small piece of tape on each side to keep the bag tight against the sides because the place to put the bag handles doesn't really work. It makes it easy to scoop inside the bag, especially when the wind is blowing. I prefer the exercise of picking poop up twice a day by bending down with a bag but this made it possible for after surgery because I can't bend down for 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Duct tape joints
customer_reviews.text: Handle broke. Starters I got this thing for $13.50 a month ago for a small dog which is a good price compared to everything else for that it is. Fits a bag, can be hung and has the fork end. All great. The screw connectors are plastic and were loose almost every use. I would tighten and move over. Well, this one time I tighten it with ONE HAND, I like flicked my wrist to get it back in place and it snapped off. It was the pole for the bucket so I can't hang it up anymore which is the most annoying part. I will be duct tapping all joints which I suggest from the start.
customer_reviews.author: M.M

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job..
customer_reviews.text: It does it’s job! Don’t need something super fancy to pick up poop. You probably will need to superglue or put loctite on the rake pieces bc they do unscrew often, but nothing I would take stars away for, it’s an easy fix. I haven’t added anything to keep the pieces in place but wear gloves so I just tighten it back up easily. I don’t use special bags, just grocery bags. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Works great !!
customer_reviews.text: No more backbreaking work as I no longer have to bend over a too-short pooper scooper. This pooper scooper is tall, made of extremely sturdy plastic, oh-so-easy to assemble (!), and has a very large basket. Works great! It is even extremely easy to put a plastic grocery bag over the basket to scoop all the waste into (and I have so many accumulated plastic bags to use). Even easy to store as there is a bracket on the main handle to attach the rake when you are done for the day. I looped a plastic bag full of empty plastic bags over the handle when storing and keep my gardening gloves in there too.
customer_reviews.author: nlw_Amazon fan

customer_reviews.title: You will wonder why you didn't get one on these sooner!! Much better and less $ than pet shops!
customer_reviews.text: This is one cool tool! Easy to put together-used silicone cowl covers to get handle sections tight! The plastic store bags fit in the scoop,and have clips on the side to hols the plastic bag handles secure. I was able to remove lots of poops off the lawn ,now, that the snow is melting with no problem whatever, and the scoop was clean! As a short woman this was ideal as handles were the right length for me.
customer_reviews.author: Carolee

customer_reviews.title: Get some duct tape before you use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product after I used it at one of my client's homes. The poles for the rake and the basket screw together in 3 segments. From the first time I used it, the pole kept coming unscrewed. The rake part came unscrewed from the pole while I was using it to reach a vine growing in the hedge and it fell into the middle of the hedge. I tossed the rake and used plenty of duct tape to hold the basket together....and had to buy a new rake.
customer_reviews.author: PupRescueG8r

customer_reviews.title: Fortify before using
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews talking about the handles twisting or snapping, went ahead and glued all the joints right away and then wrapped the exteriors with duct tape. Should extend the life a bit. Have used a few times. Best for firm or finely aged poop, no question. Soft serve gums up the rake tines quickly. Suggest to always use a grocery bag in the pan, but a quick hosing off will do the trick too if the pan gets dirty thanks to handy drain holes.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Cohn

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this. I don't have to bend down now to pick up after my puppies, I just sweep the poo into the bucket. I wish I would've found this long ago. The 'bag' part of the product that you can put in the bucket is a waste of time. It gets crunched up and makes it hard to get the poop in, and falls off, you're better off just collecting it and dumping it into a bin. Still a very good product if you don't need the bag part of it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It does what is was made to do. I have yet got the how to but a bag on yet. Still working that kink out. But the time allows for me to pick up with out bending over with the risk of it getting on my hands. It stores it well and I have yet had any "roll" out. Only complent is it seems to untwist. So the way you set it up is twisting one poll to the other. It untwist for me. I'm not sure if that is a me issues or if it's a bigger issue for more people. Oh and also the clip is kinda tight. I would say that's a good thing....
customer_reviews.author: Chad Rupert

customer_reviews.title: Rake breaks with little effort
customer_reviews.text: I am currently on my second set. After assembling and using for the first time, the rake snapped at one of the connecting points. I contacted Petmate and they were gracious enough to send me another. The second one lasted a bit longer (3 months), but again the rake snapped at one of the connecting points. Seeing as all we are doing is raking the doggie doo into the bin, it is not under a lot of stress to just snap as it is. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Nice product - slightly loose joints
customer_reviews.text: This has made yard cleanup a breeze...I only wish I'd gotten it sooner. The feature that allows you to add your own plastic bag is easy to use and discard after every use. It stays clean - even the rake stays amazingly clean due to a nonstick rubber coating. It screws together and sometimes gets loose at the joints, but overall it is a huge help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best pet waste removal system ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best product for picking up dog waste ever. I've tried other products like the one with jaws which was okay but not nearly as good as the two piece one offered here. I highly recommend this product for ease of use and easy to store and takes no strength to use. Great for multiple dog families as it hold several dog piles at once. Easy to empty and replace bag. Good way to use grocery bags. You won't be sorry if you purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: I like the rake and bucket idea
customer_reviews.text: I like the rake and bucket idea. The rod for the rake has some major room for improvement though. While using it, it's always trying to come unscrewed. I have to either stop what I'm doing to fix it, or hold it very awkwardly to keep it from trying to unscrew itself. It makes the actual job harder than it needs to be. The end that actually does the raking works pretty well. I wasn't sure if I would like it because it's plastic, but it doesn't dig in or get stuck in the grass.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley (amanda)Top Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: SO easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure of the sturdiness of the handle but it absolutely easy on your back and beats bending over and cleaning up. I got one for my son in law when I found out how well it works. I always have an abundance of grocery sacks. Well worth the money. I figure if the handle breaks I can figure out some way to fix it
customer_reviews.author: L. Gerde

customer_reviews.title: The first two I bought lasted 4 years!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought two more of these scoopers. I had purchased two 4 years ago and they finally were wearing out from the sun and elements of the outdoors. They work great - but buy the bags that fit into the base. It make cleaning out so easy! I have two because we have a big dog who poops a lot! it cuts down on how often they need to be emptied which is not fun!
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Scooper Bin is Awkward to Empty
customer_reviews.text: Good and sturdy construction. That said the scooper bin handle does not lock in a 90-degree angle meaning 2 hands are often needed to properly dump waste into the receptacle. I have a small waste bucket so maybe a larger receptacle would be easier. It is a good product that just doesn't quite fit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Designed for standard plastic grocery bags with handles makes this thing great
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic pooper scooper. Fits a standard sized grocery bag on here, it covers the lip so there isn't any grossness left on the bin. I have a medium sized 55 lb dog and can get most of the yard done in one pass so if you have a large 100+ lb dog, the volume it holds is probably annoyingly on the small size. But I would still recommend it because removing the bag with everything in it is worth the extra time. Cons? I wish it was a little bit taller, you definitely have to be bending over to inspect your gold mining.
customer_reviews.author: K12

customer_reviews.title: Great system, easy cleanup
customer_reviews.text: Being a responsible pet owner means picking up after them when they leave deposits in other yards or where kids play. When we walk our dog we take this with us so we are not making messes. I will go around the back yard weekly to pick up the older deposits as well - which is much easier than the soft fresh ones. Place a plastic bag, such as one from a discount store when you go shopping, inside the bin and push the poop in with the mini-rake. A hose cleans off the rake easily if done before it dries. I like this system even though I don't enjoy the task.
customer_reviews.author: KaseyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: so cheap you're better off with your bare hands.
customer_reviews.text: the construction is absolutely terrible, it was broken before it was even fully assembled. the poles are metal but the interconnections are cheap plastic, so the weight of the metal breaks itself, let alone if you try and actually use this.. the rake also proved to be very ineffective. either i don't have the right technique, or this rake will always leave a mess. the 2 stars are for the fact that i'll probably still use the catch bin as it does hold grocery bags rather conveniently (after applying epoxy on every ligament), and i may fit a flashlight in the pole clip if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: clubasement

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This product has taken a necessary, but unpleasant, task and made it so easy to accomplish quickly! The design is ingenious, since you attach a regular plastic grocery bag to collect the poop by raking it directly into the bag. There are hooks on the side to hold the handles of the bag, so it is secure and nothing touches the device or your hands! The rake is long enough that you don't even have to bend over. If you have back issues, you know that's important. I recommend this highly!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris N

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: As a review below states overtime it will kind of spin apart. Recommend to glue parts together! Do it! We got this one and the arm and hammer bags to go with. Yes you can use grocery bags but it’s nice to have them easy Accessible. I like that the rake snaps onto the dust pan. It stands up right and together!
customer_reviews.author: Shavonne Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: We have bought another brand of scooper a couple times, but purchased this one because it was a couple dollars less. It’s larger than the other scooper, which is a plus. What I dislike is the parts constantly seem to unscrew as I am using it. I think I will need to duct tape them together, as it becomes difficult to keep readjusting the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Happiest Vacations

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well thought-out design
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy for a plastic pooper scooper, so the rake prongs won’t easily break off. Like that a grocery bag fits well and the bucket is made with notches for the bag handles so that it is securely held in place. Also handy that there is a piece that holds the rake and bucket handles together when not in use so they don’t get separated or fall over.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Colton

customer_reviews.title: Do not recomnend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I thought the bag attachment was going to make this quick and easy to use. And while I like that aspect, this is the worst poop scooper ever. The scooper itself is difficult to use, doesn’t really pick it up, and because it’s three pieces screwed together, it always comes loose. The teeth on the scooper are too wide and the plastic is too rounded. It just does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Lora Han

customer_reviews.title: works very well, reuse grocery bags, joints unscew and can break, tape them
customer_reviews.text: Overall good design. Works with grocery bags. Negative: this is the second one I bought. The pole parts come unscrewed easily and the screw ends can break when that happens. You are always having to re-tighten them. I liked it enough to buy a new one, even with the issues. I used it "short", missing a piece, for several years. When I put the new one together, I immediately taped every joint with electrical tape. I've not had an issue with it. Doesn't look bad, either.
customer_reviews.author: Marsh

customer_reviews.title: My kids fight over who GETS to scoop!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pooper scooper for my kids to clean the yard. They literally fought over who got to scoop poop. My 9 year old son now wants to have a poop scoop business and advertise yard scooping services for $20 per yard. Best $13.49 I have ever spent. Held up great for the big “first clean-up after winter” (where we don’t clean the yard for 5 months) and we have 3 medium-large dogs with medium-large size poo. 5 full grocery bags full. Easy to change the bags. Strong product. You won’t regret buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Robin1982

customer_reviews.title: Makes picking up poop easy
customer_reviews.text: I love this poop scooper. I have two big dogs and thins thing can withstand picking up a huge yard full of heavy dog poop. This is my second time buying this in 8 yrs. The first one I bought from petco. The con with my new one bought from Amazon is that the poles keep loosening. I have to re-tighten the poles every time I use it and I even have to re-tighten while using it. I would recommend this to someone but I would let them know about the loosening of the poles.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Clark

customer_reviews.title: 100% Recommend! Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this! Makes cleaning the poop from the yard super easy and manageable! I didn't mind cleaning the poop with this! Super easy to put together, holds bag in place perfectly, you keep your hands 100% clean and away from all feces! This is the best! I'd 100% recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Our old scooper rake broke and we were going to replace it with the same model, but the price had gone up. I saw this one and the price was lower, so we decided to give it a try. It's heavier and larger than our first one. The complaints I had seen were mainly that the sections come loose. I crazy glued them as I put it together and they haven't budged. We use grocery bags that we bought on Amazon, and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: The handles almost feel like metal but it's very hard plastic
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this four stars because I've only used to twice thus far. Assembly was very simple. The handles almost feel like metal but it's very hard plastic. I decided to try this product out because I bought the arm and hammer brand product a few months ago and it broke already (handle snapped in half) so comparing this brand to the arm and hammer brand product, this product feels much more sturdy and has a bigger bucket, which is nice. Hopefully it'll hold up longer than the other product! I recommend this so far and it's not terribly hard on the pocket book.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: So Easy
customer_reviews.text: Cleaning up after your pup has never been easier! No bending over and best of all, no mess! Easy to remove the bag from the dustpan part. My only complaint is it gets loose so you have to tighten the pieces you attach--they all screw in together. Not a deal breaker by any means, but per the design and to save on packaging, I can see why they did it this way.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Camareno

customer_reviews.title: Durable, easy to clean, bucket holds plenty
customer_reviews.text: I got this because we have several dogs who are all in a fence in area attached to my house and the poo smell was getting awful! It holds a lot of poops and the rake is sturdy enough to get through grass or any leaves or anything that may come with the poop. It’s plastic but thick and basically non porous so you can use the hose to rinse it off. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Siobhan Smith

customer_reviews.title: So nice!
customer_reviews.text: Works well and is nice not to have to bend over to pick up dog poo. Only thing I don't like so much is that it's not the easiest to put plastic bags on it. You have to really stretch the bags to get it on and also make sure you don't rip them in the process. I just double bag it, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: jaacmyr

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one week
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a scooper system that would leave all the poop "enclosed." I liked that this tilted it up after I scooped it in but all that only lasted one week. The handle broke away from the base very quickly and I even tried to reinforce/splint it but the other side snapped in almost no time following. I succumbed to an open metal spade (pan) set with wood handles that has lasted already well beyond its worth. I just place the open pan part face down and lean the handles against a point in our retaining wall so it doesn't build up with water and isn't unsightly. Dont buy this item!
customer_reviews.author: erin

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two and wasted my money. We breed dogs and scoopers are a must but these are worthless unless your scooping one tiny poop at a time. They are flimsy. The bags do NOT stay in. The long handles on both the scooper and bucket unscrew as you use them so your constantly having to stop and tighten them. The handle falls off the bucket ALL the time down by the bucket that holds the poop. These are the poorest made scoopers I’ve ever bought. Wish I had my money back. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: DiAnn Dunn

customer_reviews.title: A must have if yo own pets that poop in the yard
customer_reviews.text: great product overall. easy to assemble and use. Only things that I would do differently is to make the product more durable. When leaving the item out in the weather, the plastic eventually break down and breaks. Have been using this product for 5 years now but on my 3rd one. I would spend more money if I could find a metal build basket and rake that works the same.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: But it!
customer_reviews.text: I had one for about 10 years. I left it out in the sun and finally it broke. As I love this product, I bought 2 more. I have large dogs so when I do poop patrol, it can handle the load well. The flipping action to empty it can be a little hard in the beginning but as you do it, you learn. I do highly recommend it especially if you have large dog pick up.
customer_reviews.author: J P

customer_reviews.title: Scoops the poo!
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy tool to have while camping. I like the hooks that hold a bag in there. Keeps hands away from any of the mess. Plenty of room in the bucket for the "big" jobs. We have a saint bernard..... I also like that the rake attaches right to it so when we leave for the week, I clip it together and slide it under the back of the camper and then I don't have to search around for anything.
customer_reviews.author: MelWoj13

customer_reviews.title: Easy to empty
customer_reviews.text: This works great for the intended purpose and holds alot of dog mess. The only downside is that the handles just twist together and they keep un-twisting while using. I am not turning the handles or doing anything for them to untwist. I do like how easy it is to empty when filled and to rinse out after use. The take works well in grass to rake in the stool without getting stuck in the grass.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita Hock

customer_reviews.title: Great scooper but doesn't hold together very well.
customer_reviews.text: Great scooper but doesn't hold together very well. It has to be tightened every use. Especially the basket part. Since all you do is screw the parts together when you first get it, it was incredibly easy to assemble. It is effective and overall a good product. Its just frustrating that it isn't more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: R. Duval

customer_reviews.title: This works great.
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure if this would work as well as it was advertised. But it is great. I can't bend over and this is perfect. Very well made and I like the way you can put on the old grocery bag so easily and not get your hands dirty. If you don't have old grocery bags you can purchase bags for this. A hint, if you put the container about 5 inches from the poop you can make it go right in very easily with just a flick of the rake.
customer_reviews.author: LAK

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pooper scooper ive ever used. It scoops without catching the grass. Every now and then you have to screw the handle in because it becomes a bit loose after use. But small price to pay for a scooper when u have 2 dogs
customer_reviews.author: Shanara

customer_reviews.title: Rake broke shortly after first use
customer_reviews.text: I think it was only the second time using it and it split in half! But the trash can part works great with plastic grocery bags! **Update** trashed less than two months after purchase! Both handles broke, red part holding the scoop/bucket/trash continued to loosen, I wouldn’t recommend getting this product!
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but needs to be worked on more
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this product 3 stars because I like it but at the same time I'm annoyed with the fact that the handles get unscrewed easily while trying to use it. It wastes my time tightening it with every move. It needs to be worked on more to keep it well in place. But overall it's a good product and makes it easier to pick poop.
customer_reviews.author: Dark shadow

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality! Plastic threaded parts.
customer_reviews.text: Liked the product out of the box. But the poles sections for the bin and rake have cheap plastic threaded components. Since buying a year and a half ago, three of these threaded parts have broken; making it unusuable. I would not recommend buying. I purchased a new one with metal components for only a little higher purchase price. I'm hoping for much better quality and longevity. I am very disappointed that this is an "Amazon Choice" product considering how poor quality the construction.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and use. I have no negative comments for the product, does what it says. We have 4 dogs so picking up is a real choir. This is the first scoop we had that is more or less enclosed, not a fan for our needs. I prefer the open scoop to drop in trash bag and keep going vs having to keep replacing bags.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: This works very well to pick up the poop that both my dogs leave in the yard. I really like the fact that you can use a plastic shopping back in it to keep the basket clean. It is also very easy to wash out if you don't use bags. Quality of materials is good, and it can come apart to be stored. And being compact when taken apart it stores very easily in the side of of the trunk in my car.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S.

customer_reviews.title: You REALLY need to buy this product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Being confined to a wheelchair usually makes cleaning up after my dog so difficult, but not anymore! The handles are easy to grip. Its easy to control the swivel bin. Grocery bags fit perfectly inside the bin AND they actually stay in place. The height is perfect for my chair! And its durable. This is by far the best pooper scooper!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk 😡 don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This poop scoop is quite honestly a piece of junk. I don’t recommend anyone buy it. I have used it twice and am throwing it in the trash. The pieces all screw together, well they do not stay together, and this is quite awkward while cleaning up dog poop. It is also not sturdy at all. If I could give it less than 1 star I would. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: jenjiwater

customer_reviews.title: Comes apart while you use it
customer_reviews.text: The product is all plastic which was expected but both handles have multiple points where you screw them together. Since those areas are plastic and do not have thread lock it comes unscrewed while you use it making the bucket fall of or the rake come apart. I have to screw them back together multiple times while using it.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Saves my back!
customer_reviews.text: Kicking myself for not getting this sooner. Love the length of handles. Easy to use. Assembly easy but for some reason my handles don’t line up straight with the attachments so I have to hold handles differently. Not a big deal. Overall quality is good. I wish it didn’t swivel because it’s a little awkward to dump. If you use a bag then it’s fine to remove. Hooks hold it well
customer_reviews.author: K. Karpinski

customer_reviews.title: which means that while you're trying to scoop up waste, you're also trying to keep the thing together
customer_reviews.text: This scooper set works well, with one huge exception. The long handles on both parts come in sections, which you screw together. The problem is that the sections are continually coming loose (unscrewing), which means that while you're trying to scoop up waste, you're also trying to keep the thing together. When the sections start unscrewing, the scoop section and the container section spin around and occasionally fall off, spilling the contents back onto the ground. Dealing with this is a constant battle. They need to incorporate a simple click-lock mechanism on the end of each section. That would eliminate the problem and make this device about a thousand times more useful.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Stover

customer_reviews.title: Needed some tweaking, but works great now!
customer_reviews.text: This does the job, but the pole did break down right after the first couple of uses (much like was described in other reviews). My husband altered it with some tools and screws, so it works fine now, but did need the handyman upgrade to work correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Leeann Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great design, needs some durability
customer_reviews.text: This is the best "pooper scooper" I've found to date. I do wish they make it sturdier and much more durable. I have went through 4 of these in three years...The handles are not made to last, if they could use this design with upgraded materials I would gladly pay more and think it would be a far superior product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: By far the best pooper scooper. I love that it’s plastic. Why? I was able to drill about 20 holes in the bottom and back of it, so I can sift out the sand. We live on a dusty desert Mesa with an unfinished back yard currently. I was lugging two 5 gallon buckets every 2 weeks due to all the sand I was throwing out with my old shovel and bucket method. This is great. Makes the chore faster and much easier
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: it is quite easy. This scooper is worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: The only thing this is missing is a clip system to hold a bag in place. I use a bag with this scooper and it makes life so much easier. The bag is a little tough to hold in place, but once you get the hang of it, it is quite easy. This scooper is worth every penny. The product is holding up well, so far.
customer_reviews.author: OnlineShopper

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second one - I love this thing. Use a regular grocery sack (plastic) to line the bucket and when it's full you just lift the bag out and tie a knot, you don't get your hands or nose close to the muck. The sections on the fork part loosen up, I tape them solid and keep on going. I've got two dogs over 50 pounds each.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: It’s good but not great.
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done but it always comes loose especially in the middle of scooping up poop. If it were sturdier I would like it better. The best feature is the hooks for grocery bags to keep it in place without falling in.
customer_reviews.author: V. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Great value, holds a lot of poops!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pooper scooper! You can reuse your old grocery bags and the handles just slip into the hooks on the side, so the plastic bin never gets poop and stinky. Plus it holds SO much! Highly recommend if you have a big dog, or multiple dogs. No back and forth just scoop the entire yard, pull out the bag and you're done. You can empty the bin I to your compost if you want, or just toss it. I originally bought this year's ago at petsmart but I've seen it there again. I got this one from my mom, she loves it. Mine is still going strong despite leaving it out in the elements for several years.
customer_reviews.author: L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Won’t last forever.
customer_reviews.text: Second time purchasing this item. Overall it’s good product for good price. The last one lasted about two years before it broke beyond repair. We had it duck taped before that. I think for price this is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: T P

customer_reviews.title: NEW & IMPROVED
customer_reviews.text: This design is almost identical to the ARM & HAMMER scooper which I've used for years and is a great design. Those lasted me about a year before one of the pole junctions broke and I'd order another. This time Amazon didn't have one listed, but I saw this one and assumed it was the same, just different colors. I was wrong this one is much much better. Basket is a little larger. What I love is that it is much sturdier. It is a little heavier but the pole are much more substantial and I bet they will last for several years.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Florida

customer_reviews.title: Updated pooper scooper
customer_reviews.text: Got this product after my last one broke (made from metal and wood handle). This is a heavy plastic. I have 4 midsize dogs, so I'm picking up poop daily! What I really like about this model is that you can easily attach a plastic grocery bag handles to the little hooks and bag up poop easily (I didn't have that with my old poop rake and bucket.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant design- KING of scoopers
customer_reviews.text: Great design and well constructed. Best poop scooper we’ve ever had! I’d go so far as to call it the KING of poop scoopers. Heavy duty plastic construction - so it won’t rust if you forget it out in the rain. Great tabs to hold back grocery bags- so you don’t ever run the risk of touching the mess. You won’t regret this purchase! The only thing that would possibly make it better is if it would go out and scoop the poop on its own.
customer_reviews.author: M. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the back at 6'4".
customer_reviews.text: Researched the alternatives and went with the Petmate. Very sturdy and long enough for my height. I'm satisfied. Put some thread locker or blue loctite on the threads to avoid the constant loosening of the rake and you will be good to go.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ross

customer_reviews.title: GREAT investment. Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. It’s super hard to get the bags on there. I’m not even gonna lie. They don’t seem to stretch that far over the little handles, so you have to rig it. But it stays on and it’s super handy. Makes it so much easier to coexist when I have chronic pain and my dogs third favorite hobby is pooping. >.< Just sweep it in there for a few days, no mess on the lawn, bin or broom, and toss the bag and start a new. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Casey B.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased several months ago and it's going strong. The plastic is thick and durable. Even though the prongs on the rake are plastic, they're thick so they're not going to bend against even the largest dog's business. The handle sections will gradually try to untwist over time, but I haven't found it too annoying to check and tighten them as part of the poop-scooping routine. It's not like it's going to fall apart on you. We leave it outside in the (Midwest US) elements against our fence and the only wear on it after several months is the red handles are ever so slightly faded.
customer_reviews.author: instafleurs

customer_reviews.title: Makes scooping poop more enjoyable by offering convenience
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 medium size dogs and I HATE picking up their poop from our yard. I love that I can secure a plastic bag in this and easily scoop the poop then toss in the trash. From what I can tell, it is made of all plastic, so I feel like its okay to leave outside in the elements because nothing will rust. At least I hope that is the case, because I left it outside after I scooped poop and it is now covered in snow.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieMae

customer_reviews.title: Big design flaw!
customer_reviews.text: This looked like it was going to be a quality product. I liked the sturdy poles and how they fit together. The big flaw with this is how the pole attaches to the bucket end. The arm of the bucket is just a simple plastic attachment that constantly becomes loose from the poles and will eventually not get tight at all. This really makes it useless and I would not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: ajr02hawk

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: Both handles become loose with the slightest use. The rake is not sturdy and you have to grip it towards the middle to get any traction with it, which means stooping lower to use it which is hard on my back.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Smetana

product_meta.title: Petmate Clean Response Swivel Bin & Rake Pooper Scooper, Plastic Handle
product_meta.description: The Petmate Clean Response Swivel Bin & Rake is designed to simplify all aspects of pet waste pick-up, eliminating mess and maximizing comfort and control. The large-capacity swivel bin and soft plastic rake work together to collect varying quantities of pet waste from a wide range of surfaces, protecting grass and flower beds from wear and effectively removing waste from paved or rocky surfaces. Equipped with bin hooks, pet parents can easily fasten ordinary grocery bags to both sides of the swivel bin for clean, convenient waste removal. The lightweight swivel bin handle features a soft, ergonomic grip and extends more than 3 feet to make pick-ups more comfortable for pet parents. When not in use, the Arm & Hammer Swivel Bin & Rake snap together and hang for compact storage.
feature_bullets: POOPER SCOOPER SET: This set effectively picks up waste on soft & hard surfaces. The bin swivels & rotates for easy pick up and features a bag hook to attach plastic waste bags. Measures 43" long.

EASY CLEAN UP: This poop scooper swiftly cleans up waste from small dogs to large dog breeds. The lightweight design snaps together as one unit for easy storage. Includes bin with large capacity & rake, & attachment to stand it upright.

PET CLEAN UP: Swiftly clean up after your dog or cat while at home or on walks with a variety of waste management products. From waste bags, rakes, pans, trainings pads to poop scoopers, litter boxes & litter, we've got you & your pet covered.

PETMATE: For over 50 years, we at Petmate are passionate about our dogs, cats & furry friends in general. Starting with the very first dog kennel, we've produced plenty of eco-friendly products that pets will love.

JUST FOR PETS: Petmate makes a variety of pet products for dogs, cats, chickens & other small furry friends! Check out our brands such as Aspen Pet, Arm & Hammer, Booda, Chuckit!, Jackson Galaxy & more!
